==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|青山|青山 (Aoyama)}}
{{wikipedia|Aoyama}}
[[File:Aoyama_kamon.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|青山}} (''Aoyama''): the '''Aoyama''' family [[crest]].]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=kun|あお|やま}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=あおやま|青|tr1=ao|t1=blue or green; lush with life|山|tr2=yama|t2=mountain}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|あおやま|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あおやま|hhira=あをやま}}

# a [[green]] [[lush]] [[mountain]] or [[mountainous]] [[area]]
# a type of [[fancy]] ''[[kamaboko]]'' ([[fishcake]]) used in [[ceremony|ceremonies]]

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|あおやま|hhira=あをやま}}

# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=あおやま|Japanese [[habitational]]}}
# a place in the north of [[w:Minato, Tokyo|Minato-ku, Tōkyō]]
#: So named as the land was deeded to Aoyama Tadanari ({{m|ja|青山忠成}}, d. 1613; [[w:Aoyama Tadanari|Wikipedia article]]) by Tokugawa Ieyasu ({{m|ja|徳川家康}}, d. 1616; [[w:Tokugawa Ieyasu|Wikipedia article]]).
# various other places in Japan

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|青山菊|あおやまぎく}}: the Aoyama [[chrysanthemum]], a family [[crest]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|青山|青山 (Seizan)}}
{{wikipedia|Qingshan}}
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|せい|さん|k2=ざん|r=y}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=せいざん}} {{m|zh|青山|tr=tsheng srɛn|lit=green or blue + mountain or hill}}. Compare modern {{etyl|nan|-}} reading ''chheng-san'', or {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''qīngshān''.

The {{m|ja|山}} character is read ''san'' ordinarily. {{rendaku2|sort=せいざん|san|zan}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|せいざん|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|せいざん}}

# a [[green]] [[lush]] [[mountain]] or [[mountainous]] [[area]]
# {{qualifier|metaphoric}} a [[grave]] or one's final resting place
# alternate name for the {{ja-r|琵琶|びわ}}, a four-stringed [[lute]] brought to Japan from [[Tang Dynasty]] China

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|青山一髪|せいざん いっぱつ}}: "lush mountains, a single hair" → the mountains are so far away that they recede into the distance, seeming only as tall as a single hair is wide
* {{ja-r|人間到る処青山有り|にんげん いたる ところ せいざん あり}}; {{ja-r|人間至る所青山有り|じんかん いたる ところ せいざん あり}}: "wherever people go, there are green mountains", "wherever you go in the world, there are green mountains" → get out and see the world, don't be a [[homebody]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|せいざん}}

# [[Qingshan]], any of several places in China
